extensionDescription.message: Extracts attachments from messages under the selected folder or account.

extractSingleDescription.message: Extracts attachments from the selected folder, omitting sub-folders
extractSingleDescription.description: Action description for extract-single QuickMenu button

extractRecursiveDescription.message: Extracts attachments from the selected folders and sub-folders (recursive)
extractRecursiveDescription.description: Action description for extract-recursive QuickMenu button

standardSelectionDescription.message: Allows you to choose specific folders, or even specific attachments for discovery and extraction
standardSelectionDescription.description: Action description for standard-selection QuickMenu button

noAttachmentsMessage.message: There are no attachments in the selected folder.

noMessagesMessage.message: There are no messages in the selected folder.

discoveryProgressMessage.description: {# of discovered} attachment(s) in {# of messages including attachments/embeds)} of {total # of discovered messages}

discoverySelectionMessage.description: {# of selected} of {# of discovered} attachment(s) selected

embedDiscoverySelectionMessage.description: {# of selected} of {# of discovered} embed(s) selected

alterationsIdentified.description: Regards attachments which were detached or deleted from the (altered) source message.

of.description: Used in the sense of 'x items out of y total items'

confirmDetachMessage.message: This action will PERMANENTLY delete the extracted attachments from their source messages; click OK to confirm.

permanentDetachWarning.message: WARNING: This action will permanently remove the extracted attachments from their source email messages.

useInteractiveUiDescription.message: Fully interactive UI; allows for selection of specific attachments to extract

displayQuickMenuDescription.message: Displays a shortcut menu when Extract 'Em! is opened

extractImmediateDescription.message: Saves all attachments from messages in the selected folder with limited user intervention; excludes sub-folders

includeSubFoldersDescription.message: Includes attachments in subfolders during immediate extraction

useSilentModeDescription.message: Omits UI presentation, with the exception of the save prompt

includeEmbeddedImagesDescription.message: Identifies and includes images embedded in the message body (inline images)

preserveFolderStructureDescription.message: Stores the attachments in the .zip archive in the same folders they reside under in Thunderbird

defaultGroupingDescription.message: Groups items in the Attachment List according to the specified attribute

imagePreviewDescription.message: Specifies the size of the Preview Image for items in the Attachment List

detachErrorMessage.message: One or more attachments failed to detach.

rn1_2_0_Notice01.message: NOTICE: If you used version 1.1.4 of this extension (available between approximately April 10 and April 23, 2024) any archive files you produced are likely to be corrupt.

rn1_2_0_Notice02.message: This was due to an improper configuration of the 3rd-party code library (zip.js) used to generate the archive.

rn1_2_0_Notice03.message: The author of this extension wished to express his sincerest apologies to any users who may have been inconvenienced by this issue.

rn1_2_0_New01.message: Added option for extracting embedded (inline-attached) images

rn1_2_0_New02.message: Added new version notification (automatic display of Release Notes) upon new version release

rn1_2_0_New03.message: Added permanent detach option (only available with Thunderbird version 123 and later)

rn1_2_0_New04.message: Added identification of detached and deleted attachments

rn1_2_0_Fix01.message: Removed recursive extraction (extracting attachments within email [.eml] files which themselves are attachments)

rn1_2_0_Fix02.message: Switched to zip.js library (from jszip) to ameliorate an intermittent memory issue
